description: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
notes: STAB increased to 2

description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon's dangerous moves.
Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
notes: When a Pokémon with Blaze uses a Fire-type move, the move's Attack or Special Attack will be increased by 50% if the user has less than or equal to ⅓ of its maximum HP remaining.

description: The Pokémon's HP is restored when it eats any Berry, in addition to the Berry's usual effect.
notes: Restores 33% of the Pokémon's maximum HP when it consumes a Berry.

description: The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.
The Pokémon dampens its surroundings, preventing all Pokémon from using explosive moves such as Self-Destruct.
notes: Damp prevents all Pokémon from using Self-Destruct, Explosion, Mind Blown, and Misty Explosion; if a Pokémon attempts to use one of these moves, it will fail and the user will not faint or take damage. Additionally, Damp prevents the Ability Aftermath from doing damage when the Pokémon with Aftermath faints.

description: If the Pokémon has any stat lowered by an opposing Pokémon, its Attack stat will be boosted sharply.
notes: 2 stages

description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is low, it will instead eat the Berry when its HP drops to half or less.
notes: Gluttony causes the Pokémon to eat Berries that would normally be eaten at 25% HP or lower to be eaten at 50% HP or lower instead.

description: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
notes: Attack +50%

description: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat.
The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.
notes: After winning a battle, any Pokémon in the player's party with Honey Gather that is not already holding an item may collect Honey, similar to Pickup, even if it did not participate in the battle and/or cannot battle.\n\nThe chance for a Pokémon with this Ability to pick up Honey depends on its level, starting at 5% if the Pokémon is between levels 1 and 10, and going up by 5% every ten levels, ending at a 50% chance at levels 91-100.

description: Doubles the Pokémon's Attack stat.
Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but lowers its accuracy.
notes: Attack +50% / Accuracy -20%

description: The Pokémon's intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.
The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.
The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.
notes: If the Pokémon uses a contact move, it will not activate any effects caused by contact.

description: Every turn, one of the Pokémon's stats will be boosted sharply but another stat will be lowered.
notes: 2 stages; random

description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
notes: When a Pokémon with Overgrow uses a Grass-type move, the move's Attack or Special Attack will be increased by 50% if the user has less than or equal to ⅓ of its maximum HP remaining.

description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.
Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.
Powers up moves that have recoil damage.
The Pokémon's competitive spirit makes it deal more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less damage to Pokémon of the opposite gender.
Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.
The Pokémon may cure its own status conditions by shedding its skin.
notes: Shed Skin has a 1/3 chance of curing the Pokémon of a non-volatile status condition at the end of each turn, before burn or poison damage is dealt.

description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon's moves, but increases the moves' power.
notes: Power +30%

description: Protective dust shields the Pokémon from the additional effects of moves.
notes: Pokémon with Shield Dust are unaffected by the additional effects of other Pokémon's damaging moves, including additional effects provided by Poison Touch, Toxic Chain, Stench, King's Rock, and Razor Fang.

description: Doubles the effects of the Pokémon's stat changes.
The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and may paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.
notes: When a Pokémon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance that the attacking Pokémon will become paralyzed. This can affect Ground-type Pokémon.\n\nIf a Pokémon with this Ability is hit by a multistrike move that makes contact, each hit has an independent chance to activate this Ability.

description: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed stat on Electric Terrain.
Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
notes: When a Pokémon with Overgrow uses a Bug-type move, the move's Attack or Special Attack will be increased by 50% if the user has less than or equal to ⅓ of its maximum HP remaining.

description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep.
Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.
The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.
notes: If a Pokémon with Thick Fat is attacked by an Ice- or Fire-type move, the opponent's Attack or Special Attack is reduced by 50% during damage calculation, effectively halving the damage the Pokémon takes.

description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
notes: When a Pokémon with Torrent uses a Water-type move, the move's Attack or Special Attack will be increased by 50% if the user has less than or equal to ⅓ of its maximum HP remaining.

description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target's stat changes.
Changes the Pokémon's shape when its HP drops to half or less.
The Pokémon's keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered.
The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.
The Pokémon's determination boosts its Speed stat every time it flinches
Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.
The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.
Cures the Pokémon's status conditions in rain.
If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has its HP restored instead of taking damage.
If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves.
If the Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned by another Pokémon, that Pokémon will be inflicted with the same status condition.
The Pokémon reflects status moves instead of getting hit by them.
Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.
The Pokémon gradually regains HP in snow.
Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in snow.
Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
notes: Power +30%

description: The Pokémon may infatuate attackers that make direct contact with it.
The Pokémon's Speed stat is boosted every turn.
When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon's held item.
The Pokémon can use "not very effective" moves to deal regular damage.
Puts other Pokémon under pressure, causing them to expend more PP to use their moves.
Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.
Powers up weak moves so the Pokémon can deal more damage with them
Halves the Pokémon's weight.
Powers up slicing moves.
Powers up moves that make direct contact.
The Pokémon's limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.
The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it's facing.
